Sentencas: Stabilized Bi2O3 has gained a considerable amount of attention as a solid electrolyte material for low temperature solid oxide fuel cells due to its superior oxygen ion conductivity at the temperature of relevance (<= 500 degrees C).
Titulo: Conductive Nature of Grain Boundaries in Nanocrystalline Stabilized Bi2O3 Thin-Film Electrolyte

Sentencas: Despite many research efforts to measure the transport properties of stabilized Bi2O3, the effects of grain boundaries on the electrical conductivity have rarely been reported and their results are even controversial.
Titulo: Conductive Nature of Grain Boundaries in Nanocrystalline Stabilized Bi2O3 Thin-Film Electrolyte

Sentencas: Here, we attempt quantitatively to assess the grain boundary contribution out of the total ionic conductivity at elevated temperatures (350-500 degrees C) by fabricating epitaxial and nano-polycrystalline thin films of yttrium-stabilized Bi2O3.
Titulo: Conductive Nature of Grain Boundaries in Nanocrystalline Stabilized Bi2O3 Thin-Film Electrolyte

Sentencas: Surprisingly, both epitaxial and polycrystalline films show nearly identical levels of ionic conductivity, as measured by alternating current impedance spectroscopy and this is the case despite the fact that the polyfilm possesses nanosized columnar grains and thus an extremely high density of the grain boundaries.
Titulo: Conductive Nature of Grain Boundaries in Nanocrystalline Stabilized Bi2O3 Thin-Film Electrolyte

Sentencas: The highly conductive nature of grain boundaries in stabilized Bi2O3 is discussed in terms of the clean and chemically uniform grain boundary without segregates, and the implications for device application are suggested.
Titulo: Conductive Nature of Grain Boundaries in Nanocrystalline Stabilized Bi2O3 Thin-Film Electrolyte
